item.description:

item.title: Wall is filthy and covered in graffiti, 23rd September
item.description:
Please clean up this wall of Dunstall House, next to the bus stop. It's really in an unacceptable condition, filthy, gross and covered in graffiti. please wash it all of, especially the graffiti. If you allow it to stay there it sends the wrong message to the criminals that they can get away with this ASB. Thank you. Peckham High St.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 149, Peckham High Street, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missed collection on Cricketers Walk, 23rd September
item.description:
My bin hasn't been emptied on the scheduled collection date, but all the other bins in the bin shed appear to have been. This is the 4th or 5th time in the last year this has happened. The bin is completely full and there is no collection due again until 7 October.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cricketers Walk, Perry Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken gate continues to force pedestrians onto the carriageway 6 days after it was first reported!!, 23rd September
item.description:
It looks as if one of the vehicle gates broke off in the process of the recent resurfacing, or has just fallen off due to a lack of maintenance. The gate has just been left where it fell, forcing all pedestrians to take a detour onto the carriageway. Shockingly, no protective barriers, warning signage or lighting have been provided to ensure the safety of diverted pedestrians and runners apart from a derisory bit of hazard tape. THIS IS AN URGENT MATTER OF PUBLIC SAFETY, IT WAS FIRST REPORTED SIX DAYS AGO. Is there a timetable for this protection to be put in? If not, it must be installed, or the gate taken away, in the next 24 hours ie by the end of Wed/24/Sep/25.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hook Farm Road, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cardboard box full of rubbish, not being collected, 23rd September
item.description:
A cardboard box was left outside our house around 2 weeks ago with some rubbish in it by an unknown individual. Since then, it has been used as a dumping ground for more rubbish and is not being collected by the regular bin disposal.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66-68, Canon Beck Road, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet
